subject: SIMSONN Plus X – Firmware recovery required (axes not exposed to Windows)
description_text:
Hello SIMSONN Support Team,

I am writing regarding a SIMSONN Plus X pedal set received yesterday.

On the first connection, the device worked perfectly:

Axes were visible and moving in Windows joy.cpl

Pedals were correctly detected and usable in simulators

On the following day, without any hardware changes:

SIMSONN Manager crashes at startup with error
unknown software exception (0x00000049)

SIMSONN Manager can still detect pedal inputs

However, Windows no longer exposes any game controller axes

In joy.cpl, no axis movement is shown

As a result, simulators cannot detect or map the pedals

This behavior strongly indicates that the device has entered a Vendor /
Debug mode or that the firmware state is corrupted, preventing it from
operating as a standard HID Game Controller.

Please note:

Windows correctly detects the USB device

Drivers and USB ports have already been verified

The issue occurs even with only the SIMSONN Plus X connected

Reinstalling drivers does not resolve the issue

I kindly request:

The official recovery procedure

The correct GAME MODE / HID joystick compliant firmware

The official flashing or recovery tool, if required

Please do not suggest driver reinstallation, as the issue is clearly
related to the firmware mode/state.

Thank you in advance for your support.
I am available to provide logs, serial number, or any additional
information if needed.

Kind regards,
Federico

conversations.body_text: Hi Federico Landolfi,    Please uninstall your current SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2, and then install version 2.1.3 using the link we provided.  Next, perform a manual firmware update in the software: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu  After the update, please test again:    Disconnect and reconnect the USB, then check if all three motors are working properly.    If they all work normally, the issue has been resolved.      If, after swapping the motor connections, a motor still does not work, it indicates that the motor is damaged. We will replace the faulty VAM motor free of charge.    Additionally, please make sure to connect the device directly to the USB 3.0 blue port on the back of your computer, and do not use a USB hub to ensure a stable connection.     https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download
